definition: the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: Delivers you a peach blossom, a change inone's fortune from bad to good depends entirely on it.
sentences.chinese: 送你一隻桃花，時來運轉全靠它。

sentences.english: Delivers you a peach  blossom, a change inone's fortune from bad to good depends entirely on it.
sentences.chinese: 送你一隻桃花，時來運轉全靠它。
那天晚上我時來運轉了。

sentences.english: We'll get a lucky break soon, sweetheart.
sentences.chinese: 我們很快就會時來運轉的，心肝兒。

sentences.english: Send you a large fortune turnes the peach blossom, depend on it.
sentences.chinese: 送你一隻大桃花，時來運轉全靠它。

sentences.english: Like Mr Clinton, this man can turn on a dime.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬可以像克林頓一樣時來運轉。

sentences.english: But  don't forget the times your luck has turned.
sentences.chinese: 但別忘卻那時來運轉的機遇。

sentences.english: This turn of fortune was unforeseen.
sentences.chinese: 這時來運轉是沒有預見到的。

sentences.english: Fortune turnes the tables and we won.
At the very moment when he had abandoned the fight, the tide turned. But it had turned too late.
sentences.chinese: 他放棄了戰鬥，卻時來運轉了，雖然來得太遲。

sentences.english: But his fortunes began to change almost immediately after he left Miami.
sentences.chinese: 然而，離開邁阿密之後，他開始時來運轉。

sentences.english: It'a a stunning reversal of fortune after last year's military coup.
sentences.chinese: 這是去年軍事政變後出現的驚人的時來運轉。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
full moon/first full moon after birth (i.e. entering the second month)
red in the face/extremely angry
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
warp/line of longitude/meridian (geography)
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
bird's nest
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: talented field commander (military)
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic

definition: to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
